channel.title: No GUI.java?
channel.description:
Hey Mopar,
I was sitting here coding when I decided to make a JAR for my client. Only problem is I can't find GUI.java - Maybe it is called something else. I am using a PI base, someone please help :D

item.title: No GUI.java?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Xevi, post:5, topic:478342”]Alright,

Once a few years ago, I jarred a client using a youtube video that teaches you how to do it with Command Prompt. Before you did that though you must make a file called ‘manifest’ and Inside put a code that looks like:

main-class: GUI
[ENTER]
[ENTER]

I don’t have a GUI file, but I do remember using a delta base when it worked. Although I don’t think that had a GUI file either. Is there any other way to do this?[/quote]

Yes, I posted it. I thought you said you had no Error? May I recommend NOT following any Tutorial you might find on Youtube? If this was a few year ago, as you stated, then you probably will want to delete your current Client and Download a new one. There have been a few advances in that space of time.

Read full topic

item.title: No GUI.java?
item.dc:creator: @Xevi Xevi
item.description:
@Xevi wrote:

Alright,

Once a few years ago, I jarred a client using a youtube video that teaches you how to do it with Command Prompt. Before you did that though you must make a file called ‘manifest’ and Inside put a code that looks like:

main-class: GUI
[ENTER]
[ENTER]

I don’t have a GUI file, but I do remember using a delta base when it worked. Although I don’t think that had a GUI file either. Is there any other way to do this?

Read full topic

item.title: No GUI.java?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Xevi:

There is no error when running the client, I don’t have any errors at all, but I use CMD to jar and I need to find the file GUI or whatever substitutes it

So there’s no Error, but yet it requests the Main Class? You probably should try replacing “GUI” Class with other possible ‘Main’ Classes, or find what It’s requesting, and locate the inquiry in a different Class.

EDIT: You’re going to need to post some details on your problem.

Read full topic

item.title: No GUI.java?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Hey Mopar,

I was sitting here coding when I decided to make a JAR for my client. Only problem is I can’t find GUI.java - Maybe it is called something else. I am using a PI base, someone please help

Let me guess, when you initiate your Client, it throws an Error that says something similar to this:

"Cannot find Main Class - GUI

Program will exit"

Am I correct? If not, please post a Screen Capture of the Error that is being displayed in your Prompt, and include further details, such as:

  • Revision #

  • Exact problem in specific detail

If the problem is indeed as I’ve described it, then you should Right-Click > Edit the file your initiating your Client with (Batch), and post the contents here.

Read full topic
